# DOM 事件流

这篇笔记主要简述下 DOM 事件流 - DOM Event Flow. 用于理解事件捕获与冒泡.

# 什么是事件

事件, 就是文档或浏览器窗口发生的一些特定的交互瞬间. JavaScript 和 HTML 之间的交互是通过事件实现的. 可以使用事件监听器来监听事件, 以便事件发生时执行相应的代码.

# 事件流

当在页面上某个元素触发特定事件时, 比如点击, 除了被点击的目标元素, 所有祖先元素都会触发该事件, 一直到 window.

那这样就出现了一个问题, 是先在目标元素上触发事件, 还是先在祖先元素上触发呢? 这就是事件流的概念.

事件流是事件在目标元素和祖先元素间的触发顺序, 在早期，微软和网景实现了相反的事件流, 网景主张捕获方式, 微软主张冒泡方式:

  • 捕获 - Capture - 事件由最顶层逐级向下传播, 直至到达目标元素.
  • 冒泡 - Bubble - 顾名思义, 类似水中冒泡, 从下往上. 事件由第一个被触发的元素接收, 然后逐级向上传播.

后来 w3c 采用折中的方式, 规定先捕获再冒泡平息了战火. 如此一个事件就被分成了三个阶段(是的, 不光是捕获和冒泡):

  1. 捕获阶段 - The capture phase - 事件从最顶层元素 window 一直传递到目标元素的父元素.
  2. 目标阶段 - The target phase - 事件到达目标元素. 如果事件指定不冒泡. 那就会在这里中止.
  3. 冒泡阶段 - The bubble phase - 事件从目标元素父元素向上逐级传递直到最顶层元素 window. 及捕获阶段的反方向.

那这里又有一个新的疑问, 既然捕获和冒泡阶段都会触发事件, 那先捕获再冒泡, 岂不是路径上的元素都会触发两次事件?

在 DOM2 中, 事件监听机制提供了一个参数来决定事件是在捕获阶段生效还是在冒泡阶段生效, 接下来简要学习下 addEventListener.

还有一个小问题, 为什么要单独区分一个目标阶段? 笔记接下来的注意选项框有解答.

# addEventListener

EventTarget.addEventListener() 方法将指定的监听器注册到目标元素上, 当该对象触发指定的事件时, 指定的回调函数就会被执行. 事件目标可以是一个文档上的元素或任何其他支持事件的对象 (比如 XMLHttpRequest).

它的工作原理是将实现EventListener的函数或对象添加到调用它的 EventTarget 上的指定事件类型的事件侦听器列表中.

# 语法

target.addEventListener(type, listener[, options]);
target.addEventListener(type, listener[, useCapture]);
target.addEventListener(type, listener[, useCapture, wantsUntrusted  ]);  // Gecko/Mozilla only

  • type: 表示监听事件类型的字符串. 事件列表 (opens new window).

  • listener: 当所监听的事件类型触发时的回调. 会接收到一个事件通知对象.

  • options

    : 可选. 可用的选项如下:

    • capture: Boolean, 如果是 true, 表示 listener 会在捕获阶段触发. 默认是 false. 冒泡捕获. 所以微软牛逼.
    • once: Boolean, 如果是 true, 表示 listener 在添加之后最多只调用一次.
    • passive: Boolean，如果是, 表示 listener 永远不会调用 preventDefault(). 如果 listener 仍然调用了这个函数, 客户端将会忽略它并抛出一个控制台警告.

  • useCapture: 可选. Boolean, 同 options - capture

具体使用参考另一篇笔记. TODO

注意: 对于目标元素上的事件监听器来说, 事件会处于目标阶段, 而不是冒泡阶段或者捕获阶段. 在目标阶段的事件会触发该元素上的所有监听器, 而不在乎这个监听器到底在注册时 useCapture 是 true 还是 false.

# 事件监听添加与移除

添加事件监听有三种方式:

  1. 通过 HTML 属性的方式
<div onclick="console.log('click')"></div>
  1. DOM0 中可以通过js脚本来给指定元素提供事件处理函数，即
element.onclick = function // 只会在冒泡阶段生效
  1. DOM2 中, 添加了新的事件监听API, 即addEventListener, 同时提供了取消监听的 removeEventListener(type, handler[, options | useCapture]). 显然事件处理函数注册后, 要取消监听, type/hanlder/useCapture的一致.

相比第一, 第二种, addEventListener的方式有以下几点优势:

  • 可以为同一个事件注册多个回调函数, 依次触发. 而 DOM0 的方式则会被覆盖掉. 只能添加一种
  • 使用 DOM0 会覆盖 HTML 的方式.
  • 可以通过参数决定监听是在冒泡阶段生效还是在捕获阶段生效.
  • element.onclick 注册的监听只会在冒泡阶段生效

例子:

<div id="parent">
    <div id="child" onclick="console.log('html')"/>
</div>

const child = document.getElementById('child') 

child.onclick = function () { console.log('DOM0A') } // 覆盖了 HTML 的方式
child.onclick = function () { console.log('DOM0B') } // 覆盖了上一条 DOM0A   

child.addEventLisnter('click', function () { console.log('lisnterA') })
child.addEventLisnter('click', function () { console.log('lisnterB') }) // 不会覆盖

三种方式对应的如何移除:

child.setAttributer('onclick', false)
child.onclick = null
child.removeEventLisnter('设置相同的参数')

三种方式优先级排序 onclick > html > addEventLisnter. onclick 会覆盖 html. 但是 addEventLisnter 不会被覆盖且可以叠加.

# 问题

  1. 以下代码的输出顺序
<html onclick="console.log('html')">

<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">

    <title>Test</title>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        window.onload = function() {
            const parent = document.getElementById("parent");
            const child = document.getElementById("child");

            child.onclick = function () { console.log('child onclick') };

            // capture 默认为 false, 冒泡
            parent.addEventListener('click', function () { console.log('parent event') });
            child.addEventListener('click', function () { console.log('child event') });

            // 捕获
            parent.addEventListener('click', function () { console.log('parent event capture') }, { capture: true });
            child.addEventListener('click', function () { console.log('child event capture') }, { capture: true });
        }
        window.onclick = function() {
            console.log('window');
        }
    </script>
</head>

<body onclick="console.log('body')">
    <div id="parent" onclick="console.log('parent html')">parent
        <div id="child" onclick="console.log('child html')">child</div>
    </div>
</div>
</body>

</html>
  1. 什么是事件流，同一个事件有几个阶段？
  2. 如何移除通过HTML属性、element.onclick等注册的事件处理函数？

# 问题1答案

首先参考 chrome 浏览器的结果. 先来看点击 child, 输出:

  1. parent html
  2. parent event
  3. parent event capture
  4. body
  5. html
  6. window

奇怪! 这时候不是应该先捕获, capture 在前吗? 别急, 这时候如果调换 parent event 与 parent event capture 的 addEventListener 顺序, 会发现, 输出顺序也变了:

  1. parent html
  2. parent event capture
  3. parent event
  4. body
  5. html
  6. window

其实这时候的输出顺序只和 addEventListener 的顺序有关. 是否开启 capture 无关. 因为我们是直接点击了 parent. 对于 parent 自身而言. 它在整个点击传递过程中处于目标阶段. 并不涉及捕获和冒泡. 同时我们也发现. html 设置的点击是优先于 addEventListener 的方式的.

我们再来看下点击 child:

  1. parent event capture
  2. child onclick
  3. child event
  4. child event capture
  5. parent html
  6. parent event
  7. body
  8. html
  9. window

首先, child html 没有输出, 因为被 child onclick 覆盖掉了. 第二点, child onclick 的优先级也是高于 addEventListener 的. 再然后, 点击事件传递过程中, 首先在捕获阶段, 输出了 parent event capture. 然后到达目标阶段. 同理之前点击 parent. 如果此时调换 child event 与 child event capture 的 addEventListener 顺序. 输出顺序也会改变. 最后, 到达冒泡阶段, 由于 html 的优先级高于 addEventListener. 所以被输出. (别忘了, 默认都是开启冒泡)

但是. 如果使用 Safari 浏览器, 则会发现, 点击 parent, 输出:

  1. parent event capture
  2. parent html
  3. parent event
  4. body
  5. html
  6. window

点击 child, 输出:

  1. parent event capture
  2. child event capture
  3. child onclick
  4. child event
  5. parent html
  6. parent event
  7. body
  8. html
  9. window

会发现, 对于捕获阶段的处理不一样了. 点击目标元素时, 目标元素不仅处于目标阶段, 也处于捕获阶段的终点和冒泡阶段的起点. 所以会进行 capture 的判断. 所以在代码编写时这里要尤为注意.

# 参考

  • W3C - Event Flow (opens new window)
  • DOM事件、事件流 (opens new window)
  • MDN - addEventListener (opens new window)

# 事件参考

发送DOM事件是为了将发生的相关事情通知代码。每个事件都是继承自Event (opens new window) 接口的对象，可以包括自定义的成员属性及函数用于获取事件发生时相关的更多信息。事件可以表示任何从基本的用户交互、到发生在渲染模型自动通知的任何事情。

本文提供了一个可以发送的事件的列表；一些是官方标准中的标准事件，另一些则是在特定浏览器内部使用的事件；例如，列出的 Mozilla 特定事件，使附加组件 (opens new window)可以借助它们与浏览器进行交互。

# 最常见的类别 (opens new window)

事件名称 何时触发
error (en-US) 资源加载失败时。
abort (en-US) 正在加载资源已经被中止时。
load (en-US) 资源及其相关资源已完成加载。
beforeunload (en-US) window，document 及其资源即将被卸载。
unload (en-US) 文档或一个依赖资源正在被卸载。

# 网络事件 (opens new window)

事件名称 何时触发
online (en-US) 浏览器已获得网络访问。
offline (en-US) 浏览器已失去网络访问。
事件名称 何时触发
focus (en-US) 元素获得焦点（不会冒泡）。
blur (en-US) 元素失去焦点（不会冒泡）。
事件名称 何时触发
open (en-US) WebSocket 连接已建立。
message (en-US) 通过 WebSocket 接收到一条消息。
error (en-US) WebSocket 连接异常被关闭（比如有些数据无法发送）。
close (en-US) WebSocket 连接已关闭。
事件名称 何时触发
pagehide (en-US) A session history entry is being traversed from.
pageshow (en-US) A session history entry is being traversed to.
popstate (en-US) A session history entry is being navigated to (in certain cases).
事件名称 何时触发
animationstart (en-US) 某个 CSS 动画开始时触发。
animationend (en-US) 某个 CSS 动画完成时触发。
animationiteration (en-US) 某个 CSS 动画完成后重新开始时触发。
事件名称 何时触发
transitionstart A CSS transition (opens new window) has actually started (fired after any delay).
transitioncancel CSS过渡被取消
transitionend (en-US) CSS过渡已经完成
transitionrun A CSS transition (opens new window) has begun running (fired before any delay starts).
事件名称 何时触发
reset (en-US) 点击重置按钮时
submit (en-US) 点击提交按钮
时间名称 何时触发
beforeprint (en-US) 打印机已经就绪时触发
afterprint (en-US) 打印机关闭时触发
Event Name Fired When
compositionstart (en-US) The composition of a passage of text is prepared (similar to keydown for a keyboard input, but works with other inputs such as speech recognition).
compositionupdate (en-US) A character is added to a passage of text being composed.
compositionend (en-US) The composition of a passage of text has been completed or canceled.
Event Name Fired When
fullscreenchange (en-US) An element was turned to fullscreen mode or back to normal mode.
fullscreenerror (en-US) It was impossible to switch to fullscreen mode for technical reasons or because the permission was denied.
resize (en-US) The document view has been resized.
scroll (en-US) The document view or an element has been scrolled.
Event Name Fired When
cut (en-US) 已经剪贴选中的文本内容并且复制到了剪贴板。
copy (en-US) 已经把选中的文本内容复制到了剪贴板。
paste (en-US) 从剪贴板复制的文本内容被粘贴。
Event Name Fired When
keydown (en-US) 按下任意按键。
keypress (en-US) 除 Shift、Fn、CapsLock 外的任意键被按住。（连续触发。）
keyup (en-US) 释放任意按键。
Event Name Fired When
auxclick A pointing device button (ANY non-primary button) has been pressed and released on an element.
click (en-US) 在元素上按下并释放任意鼠标按键。
contextmenu (en-US) 右键点击（在右键菜单显示前触发）。
dblclick (en-US) 在元素上双击鼠标按钮。
mousedown (en-US) 在元素上按下任意鼠标按钮。
mouseenter (en-US) 指针移到有事件监听的元素内。
mouseleave (en-US) 指针移出元素范围外（不冒泡）。
mousemove (en-US) 指针在元素内移动时持续触发。
mouseover (en-US) 指针移到有事件监听的元素或者它的子元素内。
mouseout (en-US) 指针移出元素，或者移到它的子元素上。
mouseup (en-US) 在元素上释放任意鼠标按键。
pointerlockchange (en-US) 鼠标被锁定或者解除锁定发生时。
pointerlockerror (en-US) 可能因为一些技术的原因鼠标锁定被禁止时。
select (en-US) 有文本被选中。
wheel (en-US) 滚轮向任意方向滚动。
Event Name Fired When
drag (en-US) 正在拖动元素或文本选区（在此过程中持续触发，每 350ms 触发一次）
dragend (en-US) 拖放操作结束。（松开鼠标按钮或按下 Esc 键）
dragenter (en-US) 被拖动的元素或文本选区移入有效释放目标区
dragstart (en-US) 用户开始拖动HTML元素或选中的文本
dragleave (en-US) 被拖动的元素或文本选区移出有效释放目标区
dragover (en-US) 被拖动的元素或文本选区正在有效释放目标上被拖动 （在此过程中持续触发，每350ms触发一次）
drop (en-US) 元素在有效释放目标区上释放
Event Name Fired When
audioprocess (en-US) The input buffer of a ScriptProcessorNode (opens new window) is ready to be processed.
canplay (en-US) The browser can play the media, but estimates that not enough data has been loaded to play the media up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.
canplaythrough (en-US) The browser estimates it can play the media up to its end without stopping for content buffering.
complete (en-US) The rendering of an OfflineAudioContext (opens new window) is terminated.
durationchange (en-US) The duration attribute has been updated.
emptied (en-US) The media has become empty; for example, this event is sent if the media has already been loaded (or partially loaded), and the load() (opens new window) method is called to reload it.
ended (en-US) Playback has stopped because the end of the media was reached.
loadeddata (en-US) The first frame of the media has finished loading.
loadedmetadata (en-US) The metadata has been loaded.
pause (en-US) Playback has been paused.
play (en-US) Playback has begun.
playing (en-US) Playback is ready to start after having been paused or delayed due to lack of data.
ratechange (en-US) The playback rate has changed.
seeked (en-US) A seek operation completed.
seeking (en-US) A seek operation began.
stalled (en-US) The user agent is trying to fetch media data, but data is unexpectedly not forthcoming.
suspend (en-US) Media data loading has been suspended.
timeupdate (en-US) The time indicated by the currentTime attribute has been updated.
volumechange (en-US) The volume has changed.
waiting (en-US) Playback has stopped because of a temporary lack of data.
Event Name Fired When
abort Progression has been terminated (not due to an error).
error (en-US) Progression has failed.
load Progression has been successful.
loadend (en-US) Progress has stopped (after "error", "abort" or "load" have been dispatched).
loadstart (en-US) Progress has begun.
progress (en-US) In progress.
timeout Progression is terminated due to preset time expiring.

# Abortable Fetch events (opens new window)

Event name Fired when

# WebVR events (opens new window)

Event name Fired when
vrdisplayactivate When a VR display is able to be presented to, for example if an HMD has been moved to bring it out of standby, or woken up by being put on.
vrdisplayblur when presentation to a VRDisplay (opens new window) has been paused for some reason by the browser, OS, or VR hardware — for example, while the user is interacting with a system menu or browser, to prevent tracking or loss of experience.
vrdisplayconnect when a compatible VRDisplay (opens new window) is connected to the computer.
vrdisplaydeactivate When a VRDisplay (opens new window) can no longer be presented to, for example if an HMD has gone into standby or sleep mode due to a period of inactivity.
vrdisplaydisconnect When a compatible VRDisplay (opens new window) is disconnected from the computer.
vrdisplayfocus When presentation to a VRDisplay (opens new window) has resumed after being blurred.
vrdisplaypresentchange The presenting state of a VRDisplay (opens new window) changes — i.e. goes from presenting to not presenting, or vice versa.

# DOM变异事件 (opens new window)

DOMAttributeNameChanged (en-US)`

# 标准事件 (opens new window)

这些事件在官方Web规范中定义，并且应在各个浏览器中通用。 每个事件都和代表事件接收方的对象（由此您可以查到每个事件提供的数据），定义这个事件的标准或标准链接会一起列出。

事件名称 事件类型 规范 触发时机...
abort (en-US) UIEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) 资源载入已被中止
abort (en-US) ProgressEvent (opens new window) Progress (opens new window)andXMLHttpRequest (opens new window) Progress被终止(不是error造成的)
abort (en-US) Event (opens new window) IndexedDB (opens new window) 事务已被中止
afterprint (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) 相关文档已开始打印或打印预览已被关闭
animationcancel AnimationEvent (opens new window) CSS Animations (opens new window) A CSS animation (en-US) (opens new window) has aborted.
animationend (en-US) AnimationEvent (opens new window) CSS Animations (opens new window) 完成一个CSS 动画 (en-US) (opens new window)
animationiteration (en-US) AnimationEvent (opens new window) CSS Animations (opens new window) 重复播放一个CSS 动画 (en-US) (opens new window)
animationstart (en-US) AnimationEvent (opens new window) CSS Animations (opens new window) 一个 CSS 动画 (en-US) (opens new window)已开始
appinstalled Event (opens new window) Web App Manifest (opens new window) A web application is successfully installed as a progressive web app (opens new window).
audioprocess (en-US) AudioProcessingEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Audio API audioprocess (opens new window) 一个ScriptProcessorNode (opens new window) 的输入缓冲区可处理
audioend Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) 用户代理捕捉到用以语音识别的音频
audiostart Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) 用户代理开始捕捉用以语音识别的音频
beforeprint (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) 相关文档将要开始打印或准备打印预览
beforeunload (en-US) BeforeUnloadEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) 即将卸载 window，document 及其资源
beginEvent (en-US) TimeEvent (en-US) (opens new window) SVG (opens new window) A SMIL (en-US) (opens new window) animation element begins.
blocked (en-US) IndexedDB (opens new window) An open connection to a database is blocking a versionchange transaction on the same database.
blur (en-US) FocusEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) An element has lost focus (does not bubble).
boundary SpeechSynthesisEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The spoken utterance reaches a word or sentence boundary
canplay (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The user agent can play the media, but estimates that not enough data has been loaded to play the media up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.
canplaythrough (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The user agent can play the media up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.
change (en-US) Event (opens new window) DOM L2 (opens new window), HTML5 (opens new window) The change event is fired for ](https://developer.mozilla.org/zh-CN/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Input), [ (opens new window), and `` (opens new window) elements when a change to the element's value is committed by the user.
chargingchange Event (opens new window) Battery status (opens new window) The battery begins or stops charging.
chargingtimechange Event (opens new window) Battery status (opens new window) The chargingTime attribute has been updated.
click (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A pointing device button has been pressed and released on an element.
close (en-US) Event (opens new window) WebSocket (opens new window) A WebSocket connection has been closed.
complete (en-US) IndexedDB (opens new window) A transaction successfully completed.
complete (en-US) OfflineAudioCompletionEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Audio API OfflineAudioCompletionEvent (opens new window) The rendering of an OfflineAudioContext (opens new window) is terminated.
compositionend (en-US) CompositionEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) The composition of a passage of text has been completed or canceled.
compositionstart (en-US) CompositionEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) The composition of a passage of text is prepared (similar to keydown for a keyboard input, but works with other inputs such as speech recognition).
compositionupdate (en-US) CompositionEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A character is added to a passage of text being composed.
contextmenu (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) The right button of the mouse is clicked (before the context menu is displayed).
copy (en-US) ClipboardEvent (opens new window) Clipboard (opens new window) The text selection has been added to the clipboard.
cut (en-US) ClipboardEvent (opens new window) Clipboard (opens new window) The text selection has been removed from the document and added to the clipboard.
dblclick (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A pointing device button is clicked twice on an element.
devicechange Event (opens new window) Media Capture and Streams (opens new window) A media device such as a camera, microphone, or speaker is connected or removed from the system.
devicemotion (en-US) DeviceMotionEvent (opens new window) Device Orientation Events (opens new window) Fresh data is available from a motion sensor.
deviceorientation (en-US) DeviceOrientationEvent (opens new window) Device Orientation Events (opens new window) Fresh data is available from an orientation sensor.
dischargingtimechange Event (opens new window) Battery status (opens new window) The dischargingTime attribute has been updated.
DOMActivate UIEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A button, link or state changing element is activated (use click (en-US) instead).
DOMAttributeNameChanged (en-US) MutationNameEvent DOM L3 (opens new window) Removed The name of an attribute changed (use mutation observers (opens new window) instead).
DOMAttrModified (en-US) MutationEvent (en-US) (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) The value of an attribute has been modified (use mutation observers (opens new window) instead).
DOMCharacterDataModified (en-US) MutationEvent (en-US) (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A text or another CharacterData (en-US) (opens new window) has changed (use mutation observers (opens new window) instead).
DOMContentLoaded (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) The document has finished loading (but not its dependent resources).
DOMElementNameChanged (en-US) MutationNameEvent DOM L3 (opens new window) Removed The name of an element changed (use mutation observers (opens new window) instead).
DOMFocusIn FocusEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) An element has received focus (use focus (en-US) or focusin (en-US) instead).
DOMFocusOut FocusEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) An element has lost focus (use blur (en-US) or focusout (en-US) instead).
DOMNodeInserted (en-US) MutationEvent (en-US) (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A node has been added as a child of another node (use mutation observers (opens new window) instead).
DOMNodeInsertedIntoDocument (en-US) MutationEvent (en-US) (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A node has been inserted into the document (use mutation observers (opens new window) instead).
DOMNodeRemoved (en-US) MutationEvent (en-US) (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A node has been removed from its parent node (use mutation observers (opens new window) instead).
DOMNodeRemovedFromDocument (en-US) MutationEvent (en-US) (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A node has been removed from the document (use mutation observers (opens new window) instead).
DOMSubtreeModified (en-US) MutationEvent (en-US) (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A change happened in the document (use mutation observers (opens new window) instead).
drag (en-US) DragEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) An element or text selection is being dragged (every 350ms).
dragend (en-US) DragEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) A drag operation is being ended (by releasing a mouse button or hitting the escape key).
dragenter (en-US) DragEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) A dragged element or text selection enters a valid drop target.
dragleave (en-US) DragEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) A dragged element or text selection leaves a valid drop target.
dragover (en-US) DragEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) An element or text selection is being dragged over a valid drop target (every 350ms).
dragstart (en-US) DragEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) The user starts dragging an element or text selection.
drop (en-US) DragEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) An element is dropped on a valid drop target.
durationchange (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The duration attribute has been updated.
emptied (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The media has become empty; for example, this event is sent if the media has already been loaded (or partially loaded), and the load() (opens new window) method is called to reload it.
end Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The speech recognition service has disconnected.
end SpeechSynthesisEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The utterance has finished being spoken.
ended (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) Playback has stopped because the end of the media was reached.
ended (en-US) Event (opens new window) Web Audio API (opens new window) Playback has stopped because the end of the media was reached.
endEvent (en-US) TimeEvent (en-US) (opens new window) SVG (opens new window) A SMIL (en-US) (opens new window) animation element ends.
error (en-US) UIEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A resource failed to load.
error (en-US) ProgressEvent (opens new window) Progress (opens new window) and XMLHttpRequest (opens new window) Progression has failed.
error (en-US) Event (opens new window) WebSocket (opens new window) A WebSocket connection has been closed with prejudice (some data couldn't be sent for example).
error (en-US) Event (opens new window) Server Sent Events (opens new window) An event source connection has been failed.
error (en-US) Event (opens new window) IndexedDB (opens new window) A request caused an error and failed.
error Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) A speech recognition error occurs.
error SpeechSynthesisErrorEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) An error occurs that prevents the utterance from being successfully spoken.
focus (en-US) FocusEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) An element has received focus (does not bubble).
focusin (en-US) FocusEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) An element is about to receive focus (bubbles).
focusout (en-US) FocusEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) An element is about to lose focus (bubbles).
fullscreenchange (en-US) Event (opens new window) Full Screen (opens new window) An element was turned to fullscreen mode or back to normal mode.
fullscreenerror (en-US) Event (opens new window) Full Screen (opens new window) It was impossible to switch to fullscreen mode for technical reasons or because the permission was denied.
gamepadconnected (en-US) GamepadEvent (opens new window) Gamepad (opens new window) A gamepad has been connected.
gamepaddisconnected (en-US) GamepadEvent (opens new window) Gamepad (opens new window) A gamepad has been disconnected.
gotpointercapture PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) Element receives pointer capture.
hashchange (en-US) HashChangeEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) The fragment identifier of the URL has changed (the part of the URL after the #).
lostpointercapture PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) Element lost pointer capture.
input (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) The value of an element changes or the content of an element with the attribute contenteditable (opens new window) is modified.
invalid (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) A submittable element has been checked and doesn't satisfy its constraints.
keydown (en-US) KeyboardEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A key is pressed down.
keypress (en-US) KeyboardEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A key is pressed down and that key normally produces a character value (use input instead).
keyup (en-US) KeyboardEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A key is released.
languagechange (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML 5.1 NavigatorLanguage.languages (opens new window) The user's preferred languages have changed.
levelchange Event (opens new window) Battery status (opens new window) The level attribute has been updated.
load (en-US) UIEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A resource and its dependent resources have finished loading.
load (en-US) ProgressEvent (opens new window) Progress (opens new window) and XMLHttpRequest (opens new window) Progression has been successful.
loadeddata (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The first frame of the media has finished loading.
loadedmetadata (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The metadata has been loaded.
loadend (en-US) ProgressEvent (opens new window) Progress (opens new window) and XMLHttpRequest (opens new window) Progress has stopped (after "error", "abort" or "load" have been dispatched).
loadstart (en-US) ProgressEvent (opens new window) Progress (opens new window)and XMLHttpRequest (opens new window) Progress has begun.
mark SpeechSynthesisEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The spoken utterance reaches a named SSML "mark" tag.
message (en-US) MessageEvent (opens new window) WebSocket (opens new window) A message is received through a WebSocket.
message (en-US) MessageEvent (opens new window) Web Workers (opens new window) A message is received from a Web Worker.
message MessageEvent (opens new window) Web Messaging (opens new window) A message is received from a child (i)frame or a parent window.
message (en-US) MessageEvent (opens new window) Server Sent Events (opens new window) A message is received through an event source.
messageerror MessageEvent (opens new window) MessagePort (opens new window), Web Workers (opens new window), Broadcast Channel (opens new window), Window (opens new window) A message error is raised when a message is received by an object.
message ServiceWorkerMessageEvent (en-US) (opens new window) or ExtendableMessageEvent (en-US) (opens new window), depending on context. Service Workers (opens new window) A message is received from a service worker, or a message is received in a service worker from another context.
mousedown (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A pointing device button (usually a mouse) is pressed on an element.
mouseenter (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A pointing device is moved onto the element that has the listener attached.
mouseleave (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A pointing device is moved off the element that has the listener attached.
mousemove (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A pointing device is moved over an element.
mouseout (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A pointing device is moved off the element that has the listener attached or off one of its children.
mouseover (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A pointing device is moved onto the element that has the listener attached or onto one of its children.
mouseup (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A pointing device button is released over an element.
nomatch SpeechRecognitionEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The speech recognition service returns a final result with no significant recognition.
notificationclick NotificationEvent (opens new window) Notifications API onnotificationclick (opens new window) A system notification spawned by ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification() (en-US) (opens new window) has been clicked.
offline (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 offline (opens new window) The browser has lost access to the network.
online (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 offline (opens new window) The browser has gained access to the network (but particular websites might be unreachable).
open (en-US) Event (opens new window) WebSocket (opens new window) A WebSocket connection has been established.
open (en-US) Event (opens new window) Server Sent Events (opens new window) An event source connection has been established.
orientationchange (en-US) Event (opens new window) Screen Orientation (opens new window) The orientation of the device (portrait/landscape) has changed
pagehide (en-US) PageTransitionEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) A session history entry is being traversed from.
pageshow (en-US) PageTransitionEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) A session history entry is being traversed to.
paste (en-US) ClipboardEvent (opens new window) Clipboard (opens new window) Data has been transferred from the system clipboard to the document.
pause (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) Playback has been paused.
pause SpeechSynthesisEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The utterance is paused part way through.
pointercancel PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) The pointer is unlikely to produce any more events.
pointerdown PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) The pointer enters the active buttons state.
pointerenter PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) Pointing device is moved inside the hit-testing boundary.
pointerleave PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) Pointing device is moved out of the hit-testing boundary.
pointerlockchange (en-US) Event (opens new window) Pointer Lock (opens new window) The pointer was locked or released.
pointerlockerror (en-US) Event (opens new window) Pointer Lock (opens new window) It was impossible to lock the pointer for technical reasons or because the permission was denied.
pointermove PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) The pointer changed coordinates.
pointerout PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) The pointing device moved out of hit-testing boundary or leaves detectable hover range.
pointerover PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) The pointing device is moved into the hit-testing boundary.
pointerup PointerEvent (opens new window) Pointer Events (opens new window) The pointer leaves the active buttons state.
play (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) Playback has begun.
playing (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) Playback is ready to start after having been paused or delayed due to lack of data.
popstate (en-US) PopStateEvent (en-US) (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) A session history entry is being navigated to (in certain cases).
progress (en-US) ProgressEvent (opens new window) Progress (opens new window) and XMLHttpRequest (opens new window) In progress.
push PushEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Push API (opens new window) A Service Worker (opens new window) has received a push message.
pushsubscriptionchange PushEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Push API (opens new window) A PushSubscription (en-US) (opens new window) has expired.
ratechange (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The playback rate has changed.
readystatechange (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 and XMLHttpRequest (opens new window) The readyState attribute of a document has changed.
repeatEvent (en-US) TimeEvent (en-US) (opens new window) SVG (opens new window) A SMIL (en-US) (opens new window) animation element is repeated.
reset (en-US) Event (opens new window) DOM L2 (opens new window), HTML5 (opens new window) A form is reset.
resize (en-US) UIEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) The document view has been resized.
resourcetimingbufferfull Performance (opens new window) Resource Timing (opens new window) The browser's resource timing buffer is full.
result SpeechRecognitionEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The speech recognition service returns a result — a word or phrase has been positively recognized and this has been communicated back to the app.
resume SpeechSynthesisEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) A paused utterance is resumed.
scroll (en-US) UIEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) The document view or an element has been scrolled.
seeked (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) A seek operation completed.
seeking (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) A seek operation began.
select (en-US) UIEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) Some text is being selected.
selectstart Event (opens new window) Selection API (opens new window) A selection just started.
selectionchange Event (opens new window) Selection API (opens new window) The selection in the document has been changed.
show (en-US) MouseEvent (opens new window) HTML5 (opens new window) A contextmenu event was fired on/bubbled to an element that has a contextmenu (opens new window) attribute
slotchange Event (opens new window) DOM (opens new window) The node contents of a HTMLSlotElement (opens new window) (`` (opens new window)) have changed.
soundend Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) Any sound — recognisable speech or not — has stopped being detected.
soundstart Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) Any sound — recognisable speech or not — has been detected.
speechend Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) Speech recognised by the speech recognition service has stopped being detected.
speechstart Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) Sound that is recognised by the speech recognition service as speech has been detected.
stalled (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The user agent is trying to fetch media data, but data is unexpectedly not forthcoming.
start Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The speech recognition service has begun listening to incoming audio with intent to recognize grammars associated with the current SpeechRecognition.
start SpeechSynthesisEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The utterance has begun to be spoken.
storage (en-US) StorageEvent (opens new window) Web Storage (opens new window) A storage area (localStorage (opens new window) or sessionStorage (opens new window)) has changed.
submit (en-US) Event (opens new window) DOM L2 (opens new window), HTML5 (opens new window) A form is submitted.
success (en-US) Event (opens new window) IndexedDB (opens new window) A request successfully completed.
suspend (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) Media data loading has been suspended.
SVGAbort (en-US) SVGEvent (opens new window) SVG (opens new window) Page loading has been stopped before the SVG (opens new window) was loaded.
SVGError (en-US) SVGEvent (opens new window) SVG (opens new window) An error has occurred before the SVG (opens new window) was loaded.
SVGLoad (en-US) SVGEvent (opens new window) SVG (opens new window) An SVG (opens new window) document has been loaded and parsed.
SVGResize (en-US) SVGEvent (opens new window) SVG (opens new window) An SVG (opens new window) document is being resized.
SVGScroll (en-US) SVGEvent (opens new window) SVG (opens new window) An SVG (opens new window) document is being scrolled.
SVGUnload (en-US) SVGEvent (opens new window) SVG (opens new window) An SVG (opens new window) document has been removed from a window or frame.
SVGZoom SVGZoomEvent SVG (opens new window) An SVG (opens new window) document is being zoomed.
timeout ProgressEvent (opens new window) XMLHttpRequest (opens new window)
timeupdate (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The time indicated by the currentTime attribute has been updated.
touchcancel (en-US) TouchEvent (opens new window) Touch Events (opens new window) A touch point has been disrupted in an implementation-specific manners (too many touch points for example).
touchend (en-US) TouchEvent (opens new window) Touch Events (opens new window) A touch point is removed from the touch surface.
touchmove (en-US) TouchEvent (opens new window) Touch Events (opens new window) A touch point is moved along the touch surface.
touchstart (en-US) TouchEvent (opens new window) Touch Events (opens new window) A touch point is placed on the touch surface.
transitionend (en-US) TransitionEvent (opens new window) CSS Transitions (opens new window) A CSS transition (en-US) (opens new window) has completed.
unload (en-US) UIEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) The document or a dependent resource is being unloaded.
upgradeneeded (en-US) IndexedDB (opens new window) An attempt was made to open a database with a version number higher than its current version. A versionchange transaction has been created.
userproximity UserProximityEvent (en-US) (opens new window) Proximity Sensor (opens new window) Fresh data is available from a proximity sensor (indicates whether the nearby object is near the device or not).
voiceschanged Event (opens new window) Web Speech API (opens new window) The list of SpeechSynthesisVoice (en-US) (opens new window) objects that would be returned by the SpeechSynthesis.getVoices() (opens new window) method has changed (when the voiceschanged event fires.)
versionchange (en-US) IndexedDB (opens new window) A versionchange transaction completed.
visibilitychange (en-US) Event (opens new window) Page visibility (opens new window) The content of a tab has become visible or has been hidden.
volumechange (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) The volume has changed.
waiting (en-US) Event (opens new window) HTML5 media (opens new window) Playback has stopped because of a temporary lack of data.
wheel (en-US) WheelEvent (opens new window) DOM L3 (opens new window) A wheel button of a pointing device is rotated in any direction.

# 非标准事件 (opens new window)

Event Name Event Type Specification Fired when...
afterscriptexecute (en-US) Event (opens new window) Mozilla Specific A script has been executed.
beforescriptexecute (en-US) Event (opens new window) Mozilla Specific A script is about to be executed.
beforeinstallprompt Event (opens new window) Chrome specific A user is prompted to save a web site to a home screen on mobile.
cardstatechange Firefox OS specific The MozMobileConnection.cardState property changes value.
change (en-US) DeviceStorageChangeEvent Firefox OS specific This event is triggered each time a file is created, modified or deleted on a given storage area.
connectionInfoUpdate Firefox OS specific The informations about the signal strength and the link speed have been updated.
cfstatechange Firefox OS specific The call forwarding state changes.
datachange Firefox OS specific The MozMobileConnection.data object changes values.
dataerror Firefox OS specific The MozMobileConnection.data object receive an error from the RIL.
DOMMouseScroll (en-US) Mozilla specific The wheel button of a pointing device is rotated (detail attribute is a number of lines). (use wheel (en-US) instead)
dragdrop DragEvent Mozilla specific An element is dropped (use drop (en-US) instead).
dragexit DragEvent Mozilla specific A drag operation is being ended(use dragend (en-US) instead).
draggesture DragEvent Mozilla specific The user starts dragging an element or text selection (use dragstart (en-US) instead).
icccardlockerror Firefox OS specific the MozMobileConnection.unlockCardLock() or MozMobileConnection.setCardLock() methods fails.
iccinfochange Firefox OS specific The MozMobileConnection.iccInfo object changes.
localized Mozilla Specific (opens new window) The page has been localized using data-l10n-* attributes.
mousewheel (en-US) IE invented (opens new window) The wheel button of a pointing device is rotated.
MozAudioAvailable Event (opens new window) Mozilla specific The audio buffer is full and the corresponding raw samples are available.
MozBeforeResize (opens new window) Mozilla specific A window is about to be resized.
mozbrowseractivitydone Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when some activity has been completed (complete description TBD.)
mozbrowserasyncscroll Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the scroll position within a browser`` (opens new window) changes.
mozbrowseraudioplaybackchange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when audio starts or stops playing within the browser `` (opens new window) content.
mozbrowsercaretstatechanged Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the text selected inside the browser `` (opens new window) content changes.
mozbrowserclose Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when window.close() is called within a browser `` (opens new window).
mozbrowsercontextmenu Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when a browser `` (opens new window) try to open a context menu.
mozbrowserdocumentfirstpaint Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when a new paint occurs on any document in the browser `` (opens new window).
mozbrowsererror Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when an error occured while trying to load a content within a browser iframe
mozbrowserfindchange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when a search operation is performed on the browser `` (opens new window) content (see HTMLIFrameElement search methods (opens new window).)
mozbrowserfirstpaint Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the `` (opens new window) paints content for the first time (this doesn't include the initial paint from about:blank.)
mozbrowsericonchange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the favicon of a browser iframe changes.
mozbrowserlocationchange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when an browser iframe's location changes.
mozbrowserloadend Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the browser iframe has finished loading all its assets.
mozbrowserloadstart Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the browser iframe starts to load a new page.
mozbrowsermanifestchange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when a the path to the app manifest changes, in the case of a browser `` (opens new window) with an open web app embedded in it.
mozbrowsermetachange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when a ](https://developer.mozilla.org/zh-CN/docs/Web/HTML/Element/meta) elelment is added to, removed from or changed in the browser [ (opens new window)'s content.
mozbrowseropensearch Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when a link to a search engine is found.
mozbrowseropentab Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when a new tab is opened within a browser `` (opens new window) as a result of the user issuing a command to open a link target in a new tab (for example ctrl/cmd + click.)
mozbrowseropenwindow Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when window.open() (opens new window) is called within a browser iframe.
mozbrowserresize Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the browser `` (opens new window)'s window size has changed.
mozbrowserscroll Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the browser `` (opens new window) content scrolls.
mozbrowserscrollareachanged Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the available scrolling area in the browser `` (opens new window) changes. This can occur on resize and when the page size changes (while loading for example.)
mozbrowserscrollviewchange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when asynchronous scrolling (i.e. APCZ) starts or stops.
mozbrowsersecuritychange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the SSL state changes within a browser iframe.
mozbrowserselectionstatechanged Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the text selected inside the browser `` (opens new window) content changes. Note that this is deprecated, and newer implementations use mozbrowsercaretstatechanged instead.
mozbrowsershowmodalprompt Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when alert() (opens new window), confirm() (opens new window) or prompt() (opens new window) are called within a browser iframe
mozbrowsertitlechange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the document.title changes within a browser iframe.
mozbrowserusernameandpasswordrequired Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when an HTTP authentification is requested.
mozbrowservisibilitychange Firefox OS Browser API (opens new window)-specific Sent when the visibility state of the current browser iframe `` (opens new window) changes, for example due to a call to setVisible().
MozGamepadButtonDown To be specified A gamepad button is pressed down.
MozGamepadButtonUp To be specified A gamepad button is released.
MozMousePixelScroll (en-US) Mozilla specific The wheel button of a pointing device is rotated (detail attribute is a number of pixels). (use wheel instead)
MozOrientation Mozilla specific Fresh data is available from an orientation sensor (see deviceorientation).
MozScrolledAreaChanged UIEvent (opens new window) Mozilla specific The document view has been scrolled or resized.
moztimechange Mozilla specific The time of the device has been changed.
MozTouchDown (opens new window) Mozilla specific A touch point is placed on the touch surface (use touchstart instead).
MozTouchMove (opens new window) Mozilla specific A touch point is moved along the touch surface (use touchmove instead).
MozTouchUp (opens new window) Mozilla specific A touch point is removed from the touch surface (use touchend instead).
alerting CallEvent To be specified The correspondent is being alerted (his/her phone is ringing).
busy CallEvent To be specified The line of the correspondent is busy.
callschanged CallEvent To be specified A call has been added or removed from the list of current calls.
onconnected (opens new window) connected CallEvent To be specified A call has been connected.
connecting CallEvent To be specified A call is about to connect.
delivered SMSEvent To be specified An SMS has been successfully delivered.
dialing CallEvent To be specified The number of a correspondent has been dialed.
disabled Firefox OS specific Wifi has been disabled on the device.
disconnected CallEvent To be specified A call has been disconnected.
disconnecting CallEvent To be specified A call is about to disconnect.
enabled Firefox OS specific Wifi has been enabled on the device.
error CallEvent To be specified An error occurred.
held CallEvent To be specified A call has been held.
holding CallEvent To be specified A call is about to be held.
incoming CallEvent To be specified A call is being received.
received SMSEvent To be specified An SMS has been received.
resuming CallEvent To be specified A call is about to resume.
sent SMSEvent To be specified An SMS has been sent.
statechange (en-US) CallEvent To be specified The state of a call has changed.
statuschange Firefox OS specific The status of the Wifi connection changed.
overflow (en-US) UIEvent (opens new window) Mozilla specific An element has been overflowed by its content or has been rendered for the first time in this state (only works for elements styled with overflow != visible).
smartcard-insert Mozilla specific A smartcard (opens new window) has been inserted.
smartcard-remove Mozilla specific A smartcard (opens new window) has been removed.
stkcommand Firefox OS specific The STK Proactive Command is issued from ICC.
stksessionend Firefox OS specific The STK Session is terminated by ICC.
touchenter TouchEvent (opens new window) Touch Events (opens new window) Removed
touchleave TouchEvent (opens new window) Touch Events (opens new window) Removed
underflow (en-US) UIEvent (opens new window) Mozilla specific An element is no longer overflowed by its content (only works for elements styled with overflow != visible).
uploadprogress ProgressEvent (opens new window) Mozilla Specific Upload is in progress (see progress (en-US)).
ussdreceived Firefox OS specific A new USSD message is received
voicechange Firefox OS specific The MozMobileConnection.voice object changes values.
msContentZoom Microsoft specific
MSManipulationStateChanged Microsoft specific
MSPointerHover Microsoft specific

# Mozilla 特定事件 (opens new window)

**注意：**这些事件不会暴露给 Web 内容使用，只能在 chrome 内容的上下文中使用。

# XUL 事件 (opens new window)

Event Name Event Type Specification Fired when...
broadcast XUL (opens new window) An observer noticed a change to the attributes of a watched broadcaster.
CheckboxStateChange XUL The state of a checkbox has been changed either by a user action or by a script (useful for accessibility).
close (opens new window) XUL The close button of the window has been clicked.
command XUL An element has been activated.
commandupdate XUL A command update occurred on a commandset element.
DOMMenuItemActive XUL A menu or menuitem has been hovered or highlighted.
DOMMenuItemInactive XUL A menu or menuitem is no longer hovered or highlighted.
popuphidden PopupEvent XUL (opens new window) A menupopup, panel or tooltip has been hidden.
popuphiding PopupEvent XUL (opens new window) A menupopup, panel or tooltip is about to be hidden.
popupshowing PopupEvent XUL (opens new window) A menupopup, panel or tooltip is about to become visible.
popupshown PopupEvent XUL (opens new window) A menupopup, panel or tooltip has become visible.
RadioStateChange XUL The state of a radio has been changed either by a user action or by a script (useful for accessibility).
ValueChange XUL The value of an element has changed (a progress bar for example, useful for accessibility).

# 附加组件特定事件 (opens new window)

Event Name Event Type Specification Fired when...
MozSwipeGesture (opens new window) Addons specific A touch point is swiped across the touch surface
MozMagnifyGestureStart (opens new window) Addons specific Two touch points start to move away from each other.
MozMagnifyGestureUpdate (opens new window) Addons specific Two touch points move away from each other (after a MozMagnifyGestureStart).
MozMagnifyGesture (opens new window) Addons specific Two touch points moved away from each other (after a sequence of MozMagnifyGestureUpdate).
MozRotateGestureStart (opens new window) Addons specific Two touch points start to rotate around a point.
MozRotateGestureUpdate (opens new window) Addons specific Two touch points rotate around a point (after a MozRotateGestureStart).
MozRotateGesture (opens new window) Addons specific Two touch points rotate around a point (after a sequence of MozRotateGestureUpdate).
MozTapGesture (opens new window) Addons specific Two touch points are tapped on the touch surface.
MozPressTapGesture (opens new window) Addons specific A "press-tap" gesture happened on the touch surface (first finger down, second finger down, second finger up, first finger up).
MozEdgeUIGesture (opens new window) Addons specific A touch point is swiped across the touch surface to invoke the edge UI (Win8 only).
MozAfterPaint (opens new window) Addons specific Content has been repainted.
DOMPopupBlocked (opens new window) Addons specific A popup has been blocked
DOMWindowCreated (opens new window) Addons specific A window has been created.
DOMWindowClose (opens new window) Addons specific A window is about to be closed.
DOMTitleChanged (opens new window) Addons specifc The title of a window has changed.
DOMLinkAdded (opens new window) Addons specifc A link has been added a document.
DOMLinkRemoved (opens new window) Addons specifc A link has been removed inside from a document.
DOMMetaAdded (opens new window) Addons specific A meta element has been added to a document.
DOMMetaRemoved (opens new window) Addons specific A meta element has been removed from a document.
DOMWillOpenModalDialog (opens new window) Addons specific A modal dialog is about to open.
DOMModalDialogClosed (opens new window) Addons specific A modal dialog has been closed.
DOMAutoComplete (opens new window) Addons specific The content of an element has been auto-completed.
DOMFrameContentLoaded (opens new window) Addons specific The frame has finished loading (but not its dependent resources).
AlertActive (opens new window) Addons specific A notification element is shown.
AlertClose (opens new window) Addons specific A notification element is closed.
fullscreen (opens new window) Addons specific Browser fullscreen mode has been entered or left.
sizemodechange (opens new window) Addons specific Window has entered/left fullscreen mode, or has been minimized/unminimized.
MozEnteredDomFullscreen (opens new window) Addons specific DOM fullscreen (en-US) (opens new window) mode has been entered.
SSWindowClosing (opens new window) Addons specific The session store will stop tracking this window.
SSTabClosing (opens new window) Addons specific The session store will stop tracking this tab.
SSTabRestoring (opens new window) Addons specific A tab is about to be restored.
SSTabRestored (opens new window) Addons specific A tab has been restored.
SSWindowStateReady (opens new window) Addons specific A window state has switched to "ready".
SSWindowStateBusy (opens new window) Addons specific A window state has switched to "busy".
TabOpen (opens new window) Addons specific A tab has been opened.
TabClose (opens new window) Addons specific A tab has been closed.
TabSelect (opens new window) Addons specific A tab has been selected.
TabShow (opens new window) Addons specific A tab has been shown.
TabHide (opens new window) Addons specific A tab has been hidden.
TabPinned (opens new window) Addons specific A tab has been pinned.
TabUnpinned (opens new window) Addons specific A tab has been unpinned.

# 开发者工具特定事件 (opens new window)

Event Name Event Type Specification Fired when...
CssRuleViewRefreshed (opens new window) devtools specific The "Rules" view of the style inspector has been updated.
CssRuleViewChanged (opens new window) devtools specific The "Rules" view of the style inspector has been changed.
CssRuleViewCSSLinkClicked (opens new window) devtools specific A link to a CSS file has been clicked in the "Rules" view of the style inspector.
